channel.title: Posts on LC
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on LC

item.title: Jekyll to Hugo
item.description: I use this little github site to host my jupyter notebook for machine learning projects I’ve done and some toy examples of doing cool visualization with d3 with notebook and python. I’ve been using jekyll for years but I finally got to a point where - I rarely maintain this site and because jekyll is such a flexible and extendable library, everytime I try to update something it’s becoming difficult to navigate, I pulled the trigger to move to hugo recently.

item.title: Classify Unbalanced Cases with Harvard edX MOOC Dataset
item.description: I’ve run a couple classification ML algorithm on the dataset. What makes this problem interesting is that most of the students did not pass the course. I’ve re-sampled the positive cases multiple times to make the algorithms punish the false positive cases more severely.

item.title: Draw with US College Data
item.description: Showcase on what you can do with IPEDS data API. Choropleth with d3. I’ve also tried this on beaker notebook. More details to come!

item.title: Kaggle's Airbnb New User Booking Trend
item.description: Using mpld3 to do visualization in ipython with Kaggle’s airbnb data. First experience is great!

item.title: College Enrollment Forecast (Institution Level)
item.description: Using ARIMA to forecast college enrollment for 2015 and 2016 at institution level.

item.title: College Enrollment Forecast (State Level)
item.description: Using ARIMA to forecast college enrollment for 2015 and 2016 at state level.

+++ title = “Hosting Pypicloud on Google Cloud Run for Free” date = “2019-08-21T23:59:00.000Z” tags= [“pypi”, “gcp”, “python”, “serverless”, “gce”, “gcs”, “redis”] +++

I was thinking how to run a free private pypi. There are a couple hosted options such as https://gemfury.com/ or https://pydist.com/ available for as little as $9 per month if you are willing to pay. BUT – if you are not, read on. I will walk through how to host pypicloud on google cloud’s free tier: mine is running at https://pypi.apiobuild.com/.
